Welcome to GA Hypertuner’s documentation!

Tuner

class ga_hypertuner.tuner.Tuner

Main class. user interacts with this class and given arguments are checked and passed to GA class.

Variables

default_ga_parameters – a default dictionary for ga_parameters.

static tune(x_train, y_train, model, ga_parameters: dict, model_parameters: dict, boundaries: dict, scoring, stop_value: Optional[int] = None, stratified: bool = False, k: int = 5, verbosity: int = 1, show_progress_plot: bool = False, plot_step: int = 1)

Main method to call to start tuning algorithm.

Parameters

  • ga_parameters (dict) – Parameters of the genetic algorithm. For more information on the parameters, refer to end of parameters.

  • model – Model class that its hyperparameters are being optimized. Any model class that scikit cross-validate module can accept.

  • model_parameters (dict) – hyperparameters that are being optimized. This is a dictionary with parameters of the machine learning model as keys and a list either like [None, Parameter Type] (for optimization of parameter) or [Static Value, Parameter] (for passing the parameter as a static value that will not be changed).

  • boundaries (dict) – Boundary search for hyperparameters. This is a dictionary with parameters of the machine learning model as keys and a list like [start,end].

  • x_train (Dataframe) – Training features for the given model. This data will be used to train the model without slicing or sampling.

  • y_train (Dataframe) – Training target for the given model. This data will be used to train the model without slicing or sampling.

  • scoring (str) – The scoring criteria that the algorithm tries to optimize. Accepted values are scores that scikit cross validation accepts.

  • stop_value (int or float) – The score that, when reached, the algorithm will stop. Default is None.

  • k (int) – Number of splits for k-fold cross validation. Accepted values are integers greater than 1. Default is 5.

  • stratified (bool) – Whether to use stratified cross validation or not. Default is False.

  • verbosity (int) – Determines the amount of information that is returned after each generation is generated. Accepted values are 0, 1, 2, or 3. Default is 1.

  • show_progress_plot (bool) – Whether the progress plot of the score for each generation should be shown at the end of each generation.

  • plot_step (int) – number of generations to skip before displaying progress plot.

GA Parameters

  • direction (int): Determines whether the score of models should be maximized or minimized. Accepted values are [“max”,”min”].

  • pop_size (int): Size of population in each generation. Increasing this value will reduce the chance of local optima. Accepted values are integers greater than 5. Default is 20.

  • gmax (int): Maximum number of generations. After this many generations, the algorithm will stop and return the best params. Accepted values are integers greater than 1. Default is 50.

  • fscale (int): A scaling factor that controls the amount of effect that differences between parameters of population members have. larger values will result in larger convergence rate. When convergence rate is higher, it will take less time for algorithm to reach local optimum, but the local optimum have lesser chance of being global. Reducing it will opposite result Accepted values are floats between 0 and 1. Default is 0.5.

  • cp (int): The probability that a child will inherit a parameter from a parent instead of a trial vector. Accepted values are floats between 0 and 1. Default is 0.5.

Returns

a dictionary containing the best hyperparameters.

static _check_ga_params(ga_parameters)

Checks ga_parameters.

Parameters

ga_parameters (dict) – Parameters of the genetic algorithm. For more information on the parameters.

Returns

None

static _check_m_parameters(model_parameters, boundaries)

Checks model parameters. :param model_parameters: hyperparameters that are being optimized. This is a dictionary with parameters of the machine learning model as keys and a list either like [None, Parameter Type] (for optimization of parameter) or [Static Value, Parameter] (for passing the parameter as a static value that will not be changed). :type model_parameters: dict

Parameters

boundaries (dict) – Boundary search for hyperparameters. This is a dictionary with parameters of the machine learning model as keys and a list like [start,end].

Returns

None

static _check_ga_hypertuner_parameters(stop_value, verbosity, stratified, show_progress_plot, plot_step)

Check tuner parameters. :param stop_value: The score that, when reached, the algorithm will stop. Default is None. :type stop_value:int or float

Parameters

  • verbosity (int) – Determines the amount of information that is returned after each generation is generated. Accepted values are 0, 1, 2, or 3. Default is 1.

  • stratified (bool) – Whether to use stratified cross validation or not. Default is False.

  • show_progress_plot (bool) – Whether the progress plot of the score for each generation should be shown at the end of each generation.

  • plot_step (int) – number of generations to skip before displaying progress plot.

Returns

None

GA

class ga_hypertuner.ga.GA(ga_parameters: dict, model_class, model_parameters: dict, boundaries: dict, x_train, y_train, scoring, stop_criteria: bool = False, stop_value: Optional[Union[int, float]] = None, k: int = 5, stratified: bool = False, verbosity: int = 1, show_progress_plot: bool = False, plot_step: int = 1)

Genetic algorithm class. All calculations related to the algorithm are methods of this class.

Parameters

  • ga_parameters (dict) – Parameters of the genetic algorithm. For more information on the parameters, see below.

  • model_class – Model class that its hyperparameters are being optimized. Any model class that scikit cross-validate module can accept.

  • model_parameters (dict) – hyperparameters that are being optimized. This is a dictionary with parameters of the machine learning model as keys and a list either like [None, Parameter Type] (for optimization of parameter) or [Static Value, Parameter] (for passing the parameter as a static value that will not be changed).

  • boundaries (dict) – Boundary search for hyperparameters. This is a dictionary with parameters of the machine learning model as keys and a list like [start,end].

  • x_train (Dataframe) – Training features for the given model. This data will be used to train the model without slicing or sampling.

  • y_train (Dataframe) – Training target for the given model. This data will be used to train the model without slicing or sampling.

  • scoring (str) – The scoring criteria that the algorithm tries to optimize. Accepted values are scores that scikit cross validation accepts.

  • stop_criteria (bool) – Whether the algorithm should stop if it reaches a certain value or not.

  • stop_value (int or float) – The score that, when reached, the algorithm will stop. Default is None.

  • k (int) – Number of splits for k-fold cross validation. Accepted values are integers greater than 1. Default is 5.

  • stratified (bool) – Whether to use stratified cross validation or not. Default is False.

  • verbosity (int) – Determines the amount of information that is returned after each generation is generated. Accepted values are 0, 1, 2, or 3. Default is 1.

  • show_progress_plot (bool) – Whether the progress plot of the score for each generation should be shown at the end of each generation.

  • plot_step (int) – number of generations to skip before displaying progress plot.

GA Parameters

  • direction (int): Determines whether the score of models should be maximized or minimized. Accepted values are [“max”,”min”].

  • pop_size (int): Size of population in each generation. Increasing this value will reduce the chance of local optima. Accepted values are integers greater than 5. Default is 20.

  • gmax (int): Maximum number of generations. After this many generations, the algorithm will stop and return the best params. Accepted values are integers greater than 1. Default is 50.

  • fscale (int): A scaling factor that controls the amount of effect that differences between parameters of population members have. larger values will result in larger convergence rate. When convergence rate is higher, it will take less time for algorithm to reach local optimum, but the local optimum have lesser chance of being global. Reducing it will opposite result Accepted values are floats between 0 and 1. Default is 0.5.

  • cp (int): The probability that a child will inherit a parameter from a parent instead of a trial vector. Accepted values are floats between 0 and 1. Default is 0.5.

score(params)

calculates score of an individual. the score of an individual is its models mean score of cross validation.

Parameters

params (dict) – attributes of individual. (hyperparameters)

Returns

score of an individual

initiation()

Initializes the population vectors with random hyperparameters, and their respective scores.

Returns

A list of population vectors, where each vector is a dictionary containing the hyperparameters as “params” and their respective scores as “score”.

Return type

list

mutation(vectors)

Performs mutation on the input list of vectors and returns the updated list of vectors.

Parameters

vectors – A list of dictionaries containing the hyperparameters and corresponding scores of each individual in the population (score of model).

Returns

A list of updated dictionaries containing the hyperparameters and corresponding scores of each individual in the population (score of model) after mutation.

recombination(parent, trial_params)

Recombine parent and trial individual to create child, then decides child or parent should be returned to population based on their score.

Parameters

  • parent – parent individual

  • trial_params – trial individual

Returns

A list of updated dictionaries containing the hyperparameters and corresponding scores of each individual in the population (score of model) after recombination.:

stop(scores)

Checks if max score is reached the specified stop_value

Parameters

scores (NumpyArray) – A NumpyArray of scores obtained for the individuals in the current generation.

Returns

A bool determining whether of algorithm should stop or not

reporting(scores, vectors)

Reports information about the optimization progress based on the specified verbosity level and options.

Parameters

  • scores (NumpyArray) – A NumpyArray of scores obtained for the individuals in the current generation.

  • vectors (list) – A list of dictionaries containing the hyperparameters and corresponding scores of each individual in the population.

Returns

None

main()

The main function is the core of the differential evolution algorithm. It initializes the population and performs mutations in each generation, and returns the best parameter set found during the search.

Returns

a dict containing best hyperparameters.

Reporting

class ga_hypertuner.reporting.Reporting

A class containing methods for reporting progress of optimization.

static progress(done, pop_size)

Displays the progress of the current generation. :param done: individuals gone through mutation. :type done: int

Parameters

pop_size (int) – total population size

Returns

None

static verbose1(scores, score_name, best_params)

Prints the maximum, minimum, and mean of the given scores along with the best parameters obtained so far during the optimization process. :param scores: A NumpyArray of scores obtained for the individuals in the current generation. :type scores: NumpyArray

Parameters

  • score_name (str) – The scoring criteria that the algorithm tries to optimize. Accepted values are scores that scikit cross validation accepts.

  • best_params – a dictionary containing current hyperparameters corresponding to best score.

Returns

None

static verbose2(vectors)

This method takes in a list of individuals as input and prints a summary of the hyperparameters values of whole generation.

Parameters

vectors (list) – A list of dictionaries containing the hyperparameters and corresponding scores of each individual in the population (score of model).

Returns

None

static verbose3(vectors, score_name)

This method takes in a list of individuals as input and prints value of hyperparameters and scores of all individuals in population. :param vectors: A list of dictionaries containing the hyperparameters and corresponding scores of each individual in the population (score of model). :type vectors: list

Parameters

score_name (str) – The scoring criteria that the algorithm tries to optimize. Accepted values are scores that scikit cross validation accepts.

Returns

None

Visualizing

class ga_hypertuner.visualization.Visualize

A class containing methods for visualizing progress of optimization.

static progress_band(maxs, mins, means, score_name)

The Visualize class contains a static method progress_band that generates a line chart of the progress of a score (maximum, minimum, and mean) by generation. :param maxs: a list of the maximum scores for each generation. :type maxs: list

Parameters

  • mins (list) – a list of the minimum scores for each generation.

  • means (list) – a list of the mean scores for each generation.

  • score_name (str) – The scoring criteria that the algorithm tries to optimize. Accepted values are scores that scikit cross validation accepts.

Returns

None, but displays a line chart of the score progress by generation.

Exceptions

exception ga_hypertuner.exceptions.GaParamsException(message, parameter, range_: str = '')
PARAMETER_WRONG_TYPE = ' : Wrong type, should be '

Exception raised for invalid GA parameters.

Parameters

  • message (str) – Explanation of the error.

  • parameter (str) – Name of the invalid parameter

  • range (str) – Range of valid values for the parameter

exception ga_hypertuner.exceptions.MParamsException(message, parameter: str = '')
PARAMETER_WRONG_FORMAT = ' : Wrong format, format of parameter should be either [None,Type] or a static value'

Exception raised for invalid Model parameters.

Parameters

  • message (str) – Explanation of the error.

  • parameter (str) – Name of the invalid parameter

exception ga_hypertuner.exceptions.GaHypertunerParamException(message, parameter='', type_='')
VERBOSITY_WARNING = 'Invalid verbosity level provided. Using default value of 1.'

Exception raised for invalid tuner parameters.

Parameters

  • message (str) – Explanation of the error.

  • parameter (str) – Name of the invalid parameter

  • type (str) – Type of valid values for the parameter
